interface.name: hyprland_toplevel_export_manager_v1
interface.description: This object advertises requests to start capturing the contents of another client's toplevel surface. Each capture request creates a new frame object that advertises the supported buffer types and eventually delivers the captured pixels.

request.name: capture_toplevel
request.description: Capture the next frame of a toplevel identified by its Hyprland handle. The frame will contain all subsurfaces and popups belonging to the toplevel. If overlay_cursor is non-zero the server is allowed to include the current cursor image in the capture.

request.name: destroy
request.description: Destroys the manager. All frames that have not been destroyed yet remain valid, but no new capture requests may be issued afterwards.

request.name: capture_toplevel_with_wlr_toplevel_handle

description.summary: capture a toplevel using a wlr_foreign handle

request.description: Same as capture_toplevel but the toplevel is identified by a zwlr_foreign_toplevel_handle_v1 instead of a Hyprland-specific numeric handle.

interface.name: hyprland_toplevel_export_frame_v1
interface.description: Represents a single capture operation. After creation the compositor will enumerate the supported buffer types (wl_shm and/or linux-dmabuf) and eventually send either a ready or failed event. Once one of those events fires the client should destroy the frame.

event.name: buffer
event.description: Announces a wl_shm buffer layout that can be used to copy this frame.

event.name: damage
event.description: Announces a box that changed since the previous ready event. Multiple damage events may be emitted for the same frame.

event.name: flags
event.description: Announces flags that describe the capture. Sent once before ready.

event.name: ready
event.description: Sent when the compositor has finished copying the frame into the provided buffer. Includes a presentation timestamp.

event.name: failed
event.description: Indicates that copying the frame failed. After receiving this event the client should destroy the frame object.

event.name: linux_dmabuf
event.description: Announces parameters for capturing into a linux-dmabuf buffer.

event.name: buffer_done
event.description: Sent after all buffer events for this frame have been emitted. The client can now choose one of the advertised buffer types and issue the copy request.

request.name: copy

description.summary: copy the frame into a wl_buffer

request.description: Copies the frame into the supplied buffer. The buffer must match one of the formats described by prior buffer events. If ignore_damage is set the compositor may copy without waiting for additional damage.
